problem_text:
For an automorphism φ ∈ Aut(G) of a group G, let [e]φ = {g−1gφ | g ∈ G}. Conjecture: If [e]φ is a subgroup for every φ ∈ Aut(G), then the group G is nilpotent. If in addition G is finitely generated, then G is abelian.
V. G. Bardakov, M. V. Neshchadim, T. R. Nasybullov
*The conjecture is disproved (C. Nicotera, Arch. Math., 123, no. 3 (2024), 225–232).
answer: The conjecture is disproved (C. Nicotera, Arch. Math., 123, no. 3 (2024), 225–232).
